post.title: Z3R0List
post.body: I have been busy in the past few days (and more days to continue) making and updating my own list of ZeroNet sites. You can find it at [http://127.0.0.1:43110/list.z3r0.bit](http://127.0.0.1:43110/list.z3r0.bit).

post.title: New Look
post.body: I plan to create a new look for my sites.

post.title: Finally...
post.body: I finally went through the tutorial and now I have a working chat room!

post.title: My Thoughts About ZeroNet
post.body: I initially heard about ZeroNet, oh idk... a couple or few months ago and was interested in trying it out. I hadn't done that until just recently. I had tried other projects (like [Project Maelstrom](http://project-maelstrom.bittorrent.com/)). ZeroNet is a little different. First, I feel like ZeroNet is quite a bit refined for how early in development it is. Everything seems to work without a problem. I really like the idea of a decentralized website and got curious on how to create one despite my lack of web development skills. I quickly learned how to get a website up and running along with how ZeroNet works. I explored the different sites available on ZeroNet and throughout my experience, everything worked and people were friendly. So far everything is positive. Now I just need to learn how to use ZeroNet to the fullest... as it is different than traditional web development.

post.title: Blog Created!
post.body: First post! (Just like the YouTube comments)
